result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew S. Rollie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees. If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
---------------------------
Pay Child Pornography Surcharge in the amount of $1,500.00.
---------------------------

Sex offender assessment/treatment. Psychological evaluation as determined necessary.
---------------------------

No contact with minors without prior Agent approval.
---------------------------

Sex Offender Registry Program (SORP). Submit DNA sample if not previously provided and pay surcharge. Comply with GPS as determined necessary.
---------------------------

supervisions.notes: **AMENDED ON 02-25-2015 TO CORRECT TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION TO FIVE (5) YEARS.**

See count #1.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count #1.

See count #1.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts #1 and #2.

records.addlTxt: BOND QUASHED
Temporary Commitment form filed.
Defendant Matthew S. Rollie in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Agent Beth Oliver's Memorandum supplementing the PSI

Defendant Matthew S. Rollie in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in session @ 3:33 p.m. - Appearances made. The Court has reviewed the Pre-sentence investigation. Attorney Frost confirms that she has gone over the PSI with the defendant, but has corrections. Court makes a record regarding the error on the PSI that incorrectly lists the mandatory minimum and believes sentencing should be continued to clarify this with the Agent to ensure the recommendation does not change. The defendant wishes to commence with sentencing and will waive any issues. Upon further discussion, Court continues the sentencing. Parties have brief discussion regarding dead time credit.
Court in recess @ 3:44 p.m.  Sentencing hearing rescheduled for January 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew S. Rollie in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders updated PSI and sets matter for sentencing. Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

2:57 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Defendant Matthew S. Rollie in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties confirm this matter is ready to proceed to trial but there are a couple of issues to address to the Court that they have been unable to come to terms on.  The State wishes to introduce a portion of a recorded telephone call.  Discussion between Court and Attorneys.  Court believes that the statement made in the phone call has been proven to be relevant.  The Court does not believe it is overly prejudicial.  Court overrules the Defendant's objection.  Attorney Frost requests that this matter be continued to tomorrow's 1:15 Call.  She needs time to discuss this further with her client.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Matthew S. Rollie in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person reset for November 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.

**AMENDED ON 07-18-2014 REMOVING CASH COMPONENT. HOWEVER, AMENDED BOND ONLY REMAINS IN PLACE WHILE HE IS SERVING HIS HUBER SENTENCE. OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN:
NO INTERNET. NO COMPUTERS.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ANY MINORS.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Matthew S. Rollie in court, in custody with attorney James B. Duquette.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
